column4: is there a way to make links clickable in the gnome terminal?
i want to make it so that I can double click URLs that show up in the terminal and have them open in firefox
sorry, my first question was confusing
i have an answer for you
install links2 and run it with "links -g" and you can click links in the gnome terminal (in more ways than one)
if you'd like to compile it with graphics and javascipt capabilities, grab it from here http://links.twibright.com/  , run ./configure --help  , enable the things you want and drive on
I don't see anything to add a second one
the us archives seem to be having trouble again
won't it not upgrade if I do that?
it will upgrade if you remove the us. from in front of your URLs in your sources.list
